name: Festival of Tea - Day-Long Fest to Celebrate Everyone’s Favourite Beverage!
description:
Tea, Chai, Cha, Chaya – whatever you call it, this milky, sweet beverage is the perfect refreshment at the end of a long day, or to punctuate one of Bangalore’s signature rainy days. For those who prefer earthy flavours, green tea and matcha are great alternatives to sip while reading a good book. And need we even mention black tea, brewed to perfection, offering a sharp kick to your senses? Join us at Atta Galatta on 5th July to celebrate this incredibly versatile beverage, where you can mingle with other tea-lovers!
We will have a special curation of books on tea, blind dates with books that of course include free tea sachets, and small-businesses who will be offering a variety of products for you to shop. Entry is free

name: Of Paatis and Thathas: Time Travel Treasures - Storytelling Session
description:
This interactive session is a celebration of the special bond between children and their grandparents — the Paatis and Thathas who fill our lives with stories, warmth, and timeless values. Through a curated selection of heartwarming stories, Janaki Sabesh will take the audience on a journey of love, laughter, and nostalgia.
The session will be interwoven with moments where children are invited to share something they’ve brought along — a small object, photo, memory, or even their grandparent — and talk about what makes it special. These interactions will create a rich, personal storytelling atmosphere, encouraging children to reflect on and express their own experiences.
The session will be warm, inclusive, and interactive — filled with laughter, gentle reflection, and emotional resonance. The aim is not just to tell stories, but to spark intergenerational conversations, strengthen connections, and honour the everyday wisdom of our elders.
Ideal for children aged 5 and above, this session will be a gentle, joyful time travel through stories, memories, and the treasures we inherit from those who came before us.

name: Atta Galatta Book Club - Monthly Book Club
description: What have you been reading? Come, discuss your latest read. Each member gets 5-7 minutes to talk about the book, theme, plot, with 2 minutes to answer any questions others might have. This month’s special focus will be on poetry.

name: Misled Towards Truth - Book Launch
description:
Crime Thriller Author Rakhi Haridas to Introduce New Book MISLED Towards TRUTH at Atta Galatta, Bangalore
Lovers of mystery, thrillers, and powerful storytelling are in for an exciting evening as acclaimed author and leadership coach Rakhi Haridas unveils her latest crime thriller, MISLED Towards TRUTH. The book introduction and author conversation event will take place on 12th July, 2025, from 4 PM to 5 PM IST at the iconic literary hub Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, Bangalore.
This one-hour literary gathering promises not just a book launch, but a deep and intimate conversation with the author about the creative journey, writing process, and mysteries behind the mystery.

name: 50 Above Fifty – India’s Biggest Senior Talent Event - Talent Hunt
description:
🪩 LIVE Auditions in Bengaluru! 🎶
 
Are you 50+ and ready to showcase your talent? Your stage awaits! 🌟
Step into the spotlight and take your first step towards becoming India's Senior Superstar at Khyaal’s 50 Above 50 – India’s biggest talent hunt for seniors!
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru
🎭 Choose your category — Singing, Dancing, Poetry, Art, Storytelling, Comedy & more!
🎁 Stand a chance to win exciting cash prizes
💰 Registration Fee: ₹999 only
🎉 Exclusive Benefits for Participants:
✅ Nominate yourself in 2 or more award categories
✅ Get 1-year FREE membership to the Khyaal Club — India’s largest club for seniors!
📲 Register now and let your talent shine: https://forms.gle/Pi8gwH4es8uN56nFA
💻 Pay online at www.50above50.com or at the venue.
🔗 For more details about the different categories, visit: https://www.50above50.com/categories

name: Introduction to Literary Translation by Purnima Tammireddy - Session
description:
Understand how translation works. How does one become a translator? What are some of the challenges of translation? Purnima Tammireddy will cover all these topics and more in this session. 
PURNIMA TAMMIREDDY is a writer, translator and publisher, working in both Telugu and English. She was a writer-in-residence at the 2022 Sangam House International Writer Residency. She has translated into Telugu Manto’s Siya Hashiye and Amrita Pritam’s Pinjar. Her translation into English of Telangana Arms Movement leader Mallu Swarajyam’s memoir is forthcoming. Her English translation of Volga’s latest novel, On the Banks of the Pampa, will be published by HarperCollins in July 2025. She is also the author of the Telugu short-story collection, Emotional Pregnancy. 
In 2022, Purnima founded Elami Publications, an independent Telugu publishing house, and co-founded pustakam.net, a website for book reviews, in 2009. A techie by profession, she currently lives in Bengaluru.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Let's Talk About Attraction and Relationships - Wellness Workshop
description:
As we evolved, humans became heavily dependent on each other for well being, survival and safety. Communal living helped individuals experience safety, belongingness and pride over painful experiences of fear, loneliness and shame. Among the many interpersonal developments consequent to communal living was the complex decision making of selecting a mating partner or a long-term romantic partner. The workshop attempts to delineate the factors involved in an individual decision making process pertaining to finding a partner and how those factors play out once the relationship begins to unfold.
What can you expect from the workshop?
A discussion on how gender roles have changed and gender specific expectations have changed over the years
Defining one’s value
Discussion on how one perceives one value/ and relevance to be in the context of society and family
Discussion on value acquired in family of origin (attachment-based value)
Discussion on value acquired among peers/society/communities based on attributes like intellect, physical looks, social status, financial resources
Dynamic interaction between these two different systems of value.
Do we tend to enhance our value through associating with a certain partner and if so how much does that play into attraction?
What is power and control in a relationship
How much does unresolved memories contribute to our concept of value
Introducing the concept of exile and critical self
Why do we tend to seek affection from those who have hurt us?
Deeper discussion in to Anatomy of shame and how much it contributes to attraction
Regular refreshments will be provided.
The workshop is organised by Dr Mathai Fenn, Dr Nimesh George And Dr Gokul Ratakonda, all of whom are practising psychotherapists and psychologists.
performer:
Gokul R. , 
Mathai Fenn, 
Nimesh George,

name: Crossroads - July Storytelling Meetup for Adults
description:
There comes a moment in every journey where the path splits… and we must choose.
We invite you to an evening of stories shaped by crossroads — those powerful turning points in life, myth, and memory.
A crossroads can be literal or symbolic:
A place where one road ends and many begin.
A moment where a choice changes everything.
A pause between what was and what will be.
We invite you to bring a story to share:
Whether your story is from your own life or from the distant echoes of tradition, this is a space to listen, share, and be moved.
Join us as we explore together these moments of decision, doubts or destiny that shape our paths. Let’s gather, listen, and find the way forward in a story.
About BSS 
BSS is a not-for-profit organization established in the year 2013 by like-minded story lovers with the sole idea of reviving and promoting the oral storytelling traditions in India. The monthly meet-up for adults by the BANGALORE STORYTELLING SOCIETY, that began in 2013, aims to revive the traditional way of sharing tales amidst a gathering.  This is one of the longest running meetups in India.
Any questions? We are glad to help. WhatsApp: 9845680816

name: Literary Evening with Mr. Paavannan - Session
description:
Paavannan is a Tamil writer known for his literary work, including short stories, literary criticism, and children's songs. He has also translated literary works from Kannada. Renowned for depicting the Pondicherry-Cuddalore region with realistic aesthetics.

Join us for an enriching literary evening featuring a special conversation and Q&A session with Mr. Paavannan, where he will share insights into his creative journey, inspirations, and the socio-cultural themes in his work.

name: The AG Lit Sisters - Monthly Book Club
description:
🎉📚 AG Lit Sisters — July Book Club Alert! 📚🎉
✨ Theme: Second Chances & Fresh Starts
👗 Dress Code: Whites & pastels (we’re channeling soft girl energy)
This month, we’re cheering on the quiet comebacks, the messy do-overs, and the beautiful chaos of trying again. 🌱✨
We’re diving into:
📖 Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine (awkward, honest, and unexpectedly moving)
📖 The Authenticity Project (where truth sets lives in motion)
📖 Anxious People (chaotic healing via strangers and one hostage situation)
💡This time, there’s a twist!
Each sister must bring a book that fits the theme - maybe one that gave you a fresh start, one you’d recommend to someone who needs a second chance, or even one that just feels like renewal. It could be something you’ve read, loved, or plan to read soon. We’ll share, swap, and spark fresh conversations!
Expect:
☕ Stories that heal
💬 Laughter, nostalgia, and maybe a few full-circle moments
💌 And a whole lot of “Omg this book changed me!”
We’re not just flipping pages. We’re turning corners - together. Come for the stories, stay for the sisterhood.

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

description:

name: The Bougainvillea Circle - Connection Circle
description:
"Sawubona" a Zulu Greeting meaning, "We See You". At Bougainvillea Circles you are offered a space to be heard, seen, welcomed as you are. A non-judgmental, safe, trusted space where you are free to be all that you want to be. Nothing More, Nothing less. No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!
Remember - Sawubona: We See You.

name: A Kerala Story - For Better or Verse - Interactive Session
description:
If Elephants Could Talk – An empowering tale that communicates the power even young children can have to change things around them.
Twelve-year-old Meenakshi hasn’t spoken a word since her Amma passed away about six months ago. Teased and troubled at school, she finds her safe place in dance where she can escape from reality for a few hours. One day, she meets the temple elephant, Ganeshan, and an unusual friendship forms between them. But when the gentle Ganeshan is ill-treated, Meenakshi decides to speak up to save other elephants from a similar fate.
Can Meenakshi find her voice again?
What happens to Ganeshan?
How does she help the other elephants?
Find out in this heart-warming and uplifting story of friendship, hope and healing!
About Ranjeeta 
Ranjeeta Raam grew up in a small town in Kerala, India, wishing that characters from her favourite books would step off the pages and become her friends. As an adult, she worked in different areas of writing, quitting her last job as a scriptwriter to become a full-time novelist. Ranjeeta loves novels in verse and believes in the economy of words to tell a powerful story. Writing brought her close to her culture and she hopes to bring out those aspects of it that are lesser known. If Elephants Could Talk is her first novel. She currently lives in Dubai with her husband, two daughters and two cats.

name: What's Your Price, Mr. Shivaswamy? - Book Discussion
description:
Having worked all his life, Shivaswamy eagerly awaits the serenity of retirement. But his plans are suddenly upturned when his attempts to buy a house are scuppered by unscrupulous builders. Suddenly, he realizes that he might have to join the workforce again. What follows is a tale of gentle satire that is also an intense human drama. Shivaswamy faces the toughest choice, one that threatens the values that have sustained him throughout his life.
Set in contemporary Bengaluru, What’s Your Price, Mr Shivaswamy? is an elegantly crafted and deeply engaging story about a man torn between material necessities and spiritual aspirations. How much would you sacrifice for some peace of mind?
Translated into English by the author himself, this novel was originally published in Kannada as Ondondu Talegu Ondondu Bele. Join us for a discussion with the author on 19th July at 6.30 PM!

name: Journaling Workshop - Slow Journaling Workshop
description:
Best friending journaling – a slow workshop to meet your journal like a true friend!
Join us for a gentle, expressive 2-hour journaling workshop designed for anyone looking to slow down, reflect, and reconnect with themselves and others. This isn’t about writing neatly or every day. It’s about using art, words, scraps, sketches, and stories to find meaning in the mess.
Whether you’re a fresh-in-the-city soul, a quiet creator, or simply someone rebuilding after a life shift, this space is for you.
We’ll explore creative prompts, memory-based journaling, and playful scrapbooking techniques to help you best-friend your journal, one page at a time.
🗓 Date: Sunday, 20th July 2024
🕑 Time: 2:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m.
📍 venue: Attata Galatta, Bengaluru
💸 Ticket: ₹299 (includes a cup of filter coffee ☕)
🧺 Bring: your journal, small keepsakes or scraps, memories and a curious heart
No journaling experience needed—just come as you are.

name: Food In Indian Literature - Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
July Read: Beef, Brahmins & Broken Men by B.R.Ambedkar
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Deevara Chittara - Book Launch
description: Center for Revival of Indigenous Art (CFRIA) a Bengaluru non-profit presents its seminal work on Chittara: 'Deevara Chittara: the artform, the people, their culture', a significant milestone in the documentation and celebration of this indigenous folk art from Karnataka. The book brings out the essence of Malenad region's rich cultural heritage, of which Chittara is an integral part. Join us for the launch of this meticulously crafted coffee table book (Co-authors Geetha Bhat and Smitha Tumuluru, with photography by Smitha Tumuluru and publication design and illustrations by Namrata Cavale). Engage with artists from the Deevaru community and gain insights into their cultural practices. Witness a Deevaru artist use a natural fibre brush and bring a Chittara painting to life, to the accompaniment of live singing, and join in thought provoking conversations around artists, remuneration, eco-friendly crafts, the role of women and the future of art.
performer: Center for Revival of Indigenous Art

name: Make the Second Half Count - A Mid-Year Review Workshop
description:
A Mid-Year Check-In Workshop using the Work-Life Planner Journal.
📖🖊️ For anyone who wants to pause, reflect and reset — personally and professionally.
Wait, how is it July already?
The to-do lists, Zoom calls, life updates, overthinking spirals… and now suddenly half the year is gone?
Whether you`re feeling proud, stuck, burnt out, or just confused — this workshop is your moment to pause and check in with yourself.
This isn’t just about goals.
It’s about how you felt doing all of it. What mattered. What didn’t. And what you want the rest of the year to feel like — in your work, life, energy, and self.
Join us for a guided 75-minute session that blends reflection, journaling, and realignment — using the Work-Life Planner Journal to help you reset with clarity (and a little gentleness).
💬 In this workshop, you will:
✅ Reflect on what’s worked and what hasn’t in the first half of 2025
✅ Use powerful prompts from the Work-Life Planner Journal to assess where your energy has gone
✅ Set meaningful personal and work goals for the second half of the year
✅ Redefine “success” on your terms (not what Instagram told you)
You’ll laugh, you might cry, and most importantly — you’ll leave feeling lighter and clearer.
No pressure. Just presence.
Come as you are. No journaling experience needed.
🪑 Limited seats only (15 max)
🎟️ INR 350 & INR 250 (early bird offer)  
📍 Atta Galatta, Bangalore
📔 Journal sheets + pens provided

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
The next dates for Queer Quiet Hours are here!  
Queer Quiet Hours is back — a cozy space to rest, make art, and just be. No pressure to talk, no need to perform. Just soft community vibes and gentle company. Bring your own project or come as you are. We'll have plenty of art stuff for you to use.
✨ For LGBTQIA+ folks only. We haven't opened it up to allies yet.

🆓 Free to join. Limited spots.

📸 No photos taken without clear consent.

Spots are limited - Sign up!

✨ For LGBTQIA+ folks only. We haven't opened it up to allies yet.

🆓 Free to join. Limited spots.

📸 No photos taken without clear consent.

Spots are limited - Sign up!
